newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bomb damages town hall in northern Corsica.
newsitem.headline: Bomb damages town hall in northern Corsica.

text.p: A bomb exploded overnight outside a town hall in Borgo, northern Corsica, badly damaging the town offices and surrounding buildings but causing no injuries, police said on Sunday.

No one immediately claimed responsibility for the blast, but police said it bore the hallmarks of Corsican separatists waging a two-decade-long campaign for greater autonomy from mainland France for the Mediterranean resort island.

Borgo's mayor is Anne-Marie Natali, the spouse of Corsican politician Paul Natali, who is a member of the Corsican territorial assembly, president of the northern Corsican General Council and president of the departmental Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
Various properties owned by the couple have been the targets of several previous bombing attacks on the island.
